Abstract: This paper explores the evolving role of linguistics as a discipline and its increasing relevance across various fields of study. It examines the transdisciplinary trends in language research, highlighting how linguistic principles and methodologies are being applied in diverse academic domains. The study investigates the integration of linguistic approaches in fields such as cognitive science, computer science, and social sciences. By analyzing recent literature and case studies, the paper demonstrates how the study of language has become a crucial component in understanding complex phenomena beyond traditional linguistic boundaries, fostering innovative research and interdisciplinary collaboration.
